data.name: Baro
data.value: Influence of the Baro sensor on the throttle (proportional use 0-8). Zero is off.

data.name: InertialScheme
data.value: "Reserved" is for gke so don't use or bad things could happen;).

data.name: AircraftMass
data.value: Estimated hover/cruise throttle - updated by UAVX in flight.

data.name: Failsafes
data.value: It is STRONGLY recommended you ENABLE failsafes. If you choose to do so then the behaviour of your aircraft on loss of the radio control link will be UNPREDICTABLE. See the Failsafes Wiki

data.name: ManualAltHold
data.value: Overrides altitude hold except in failsafe. Useful if a fixed wing aircraft is visible but you may have lost orientation and need to do a RTH while managing throttle.

data.name: RTHDescend
data.value: Enables automatic descend after a short delay upon reaching the Origin when using RTH.

data.name: FastStart
data.value: Uses the gyro bias from IMU calibration and in theory allows takeoffs without needing to be still immediately after arming.

data.name: BLHeli
data.value: Enables ESC programming using BLHeliSuite.

data.name: Glider
data.value: Allows aircraft to expore autonomous thermal hunting. WP nav must be disabled.

data.name: RebootConfig
data.value: POTENTIALLY DANGEROUS USE AT YOUR OWN RISK- If checked forces a reboot if any parameter changes which may as a consequence change the Arm processor port pin functions. This includes changes to aircraft type specifically the control of motors and servos, rx type, gps port. The result is identical to a power cycle and can be used to avoid the flashing catastrophe flashing LEDs which some may find annoying/inconvenient but without causing a pause to allow you to rethink your changes.

data.name: unassigned
data.value: UNASSIGNED CONFIG2 CHECKBOX - GKE.

data.name: MadgwickKp
data.value: Controls how much correction to gyro drift is applied by the accelerometer for the Madgwick attitude estimators. Too large causes jitter and over reliance on the accelerometers. Too small may cause drift from level flight.

data.name: RxType
data.value: There are a wide range of options available for connecting receivers to UAVX. CompoundPPM, or CPPM is when a single channel on the Rx provides all channels as a packet, ParallelPPM is when you connect all channels to UAVX. Spektrum and SBUS use serial data based transmission.

data.name: ArmingMode
data.value: The stick format of your Tx: Mode 1: Rudder/Elevator left hand Throttle/Ailerons right hand. Roll available for arming. Mode 2: Rudder/Throttle left hand Ailerons/Elevator right hand. Rudder available for arming.

data.name: BaroDif
data.value: Influence of the Baro sensor on the throttle (differential use 1-16.

data.name: AltProp
data.value: Controls by how much motor(s) throttles should be adjusted to achieve desired climb/descent rate.

data.name: AltInt
data.value: Throttle compensation for reducing the final altitude error. Experiment!

data.name: AltIntLimit
data.value: Controls the maximum influence of the altitude integral value.

data.name: PitchRollScale
data.value: Temperature compensation for Baro sensor (use 0) It is always best to allow the quad to aclimate to a temperature change for 5-10 minutes before flying.

data.name: Differential
data.value: Corrects oscillations. The value is too high or too low, when the quad bounces or oscillates. For Yaw use 0.

data.name: DifferentialFC
data.value: Reduces noise or jitters in inertial position estimates including altitude hold.

data.name: AttThrFF
data.value: Determines the thorottle compensation required to overcome loss of lift in a multicopter when pitching and/or rolling.

data.name: FWRollPitchFF
data.value: For FW determines the fraction of roll command applied to elevator to lift nose in turns.

data.name: FWPitchThrottleFF
data.value: For FW determines the fraction of elevator command applied to throttle to maintain AS.

data.name: FWMaxROC
data.value: FW maximum ROC the aircraft is capable of at full throttle.

data.name: MaxPitchAngle
data.value: Mainly for FW but for multicopters should be set to the same value for Max Roll Angle parameter. Maximum pitch angle in angle control and navigation. Helps limit deep dives and stalls when climbing.

data.name: MaxRollAngle
data.value: Maximum roll angle in angle control and navigation.

data.name: MaxAltComp
data.value: The maximum throttle compensation above or below cruise throttle permitted for altitude control.

data.name: FWDifferential
data.value: FW the fraction of down aileron/elevon relative to the other wings up aileron/elevon to counter adverse yaw. Note that flying wings do not normally use differential as it rusults in an elevator action from the difference.

data.name: AirspeedSensor
data.value: The type of airspeed sensor if any. Ideally one is required for a FW aircraft as GPS groundspeed is not airspeed if there is any wind.

data.name: BestROC
data.value: The best rate of climb (ROC) for all aircraft types. Also acts as the upper limit in autonomous flight and for altitude hold corrections.

data.name: FWGlideAngleOffset
data.value: FW glide pitch angle offset. You will almost certainly have to trim the aircraft using your Tx to establish acceptable glide performance. UAVX measures the pitch angle in flight relative to the calibrated zero pitch angle. You should should trim your accelorometers to get this angle as close as possible to zero and remove your Tx trims.

data.name: FWFlapDecayTime
data.value: FW the time it takes for flaps/spoilers/airbrakes to close.

data.name: FWAltHoldDecayTime
data.value: When the altitude sensor changes from RF to baro or baro to RF in flight while holding altitude the altitude hold disengages and has to be re-acquired. THis is the time it takes for the altitude hold compensation applied to the throttle is maintained to prevent sudden changes in altitude.

data.name: WPNavigation
data.value: Enables WP navigation selection. RTH always remains available. WP navigation requires bi-directional telemetry with UAVXNav.

data.name: NavPosition
data.value: Determines the desired velocity for a given Nav position error.

data.name: NavVelocity
data.value: Determines the desired attitude angle for a given Nav velocity error.

data.name: NavWind
data.value: Determines the attitude correction required to compensate for Wind by integrating the velocity errror.

data.name: DescentDelay
data.value: The time after which the quad will automatically descend after reaching the Origin when performing a RTH.

data.name: Horizon
data.value: Determines what percentage of stick movement is needed for full acro/gyro mode.

data.name: Acro
data.value: Controls how much correction to gyro drift is applied by the magnetometer for the Madgwick attitude estimators.

data.name: AltKd
data.value: Reduces rate of climb or descent when changing between different altitudes helping to prevent overshoots in altitude.

data.name: DescentRate
data.value: This controls the maximum descent rate when changing to a new lower altitude in WP navigation or when performing and Autoland. Units are in decimetres.

data.name: LEDs
data.value: Enables or disables external WS2812 LEDs.

data.name: Hysteresis
data.value: Desired heading is updated if the yaw stick movement is greater than this value. It is difficult not to input a yaw command when moving the stick forward or backward! Note: You should NEVER have Roll/Pitch or Yaw trim offsets in your Tx. Use the accelerometer trimming process to get stable hover position. If you use Yaw trim you will NOT have heading hold.

data.name: GyroLPF
data.value: Sets the frequency above which the gyros will reduce their output signal. The dynamics of most multicopters are thought to be below 100Hz so if you set the gyro LPF below that then the aircraft response may be sluggish. Suggest 98 or 188Hz.

data.name: ControlScheme
data.value: Enables fast descents when navigating but multicopter will force a spiral orbit to avoid VRS.

data.name: PositionVelocity
data.value: Determines how aggressively the hold position is held. Lower values for softer hold minimising jitters.

data.name: AuxMode
data.value: Compensates for magnetometers mounted inverted in GPS masts.

data.name: Emulation
data.value: Allows the aircraft to be "flown" as an emulation/simulation using UAVXGS or UAVXNav. Motors are disabled but props should be off or motors disconnected for safety.

data.name: Impuls
data.value: The time between motor control updates. Minimum recommended value is 5. Normal value is 5 to 8. Values will vary depending on your model of Tx and Rx and ESC's. Note how motors start and the stick responsiveness and flight performance. Usually the higher the value, the slower the stick response will feel. Oscillations might occur with too high or too low a setting. Adjust if necessary for the best overall performance!

data.name: AltDifferential
data.value: Uses the yaw axis accelerometer to dampen rate of climb/descent.

data.name: AltIntegral
data.value: Reduces the final error in altitude hold.

data.name: Integral
data.value: Always the same sign as proportional! Affects the total gyro/acc value over time. The higher the value, the more accelerometer self-leveling emphasis there will be. A value too high causes the quad to osciillate, a value that is too small causes a poor return to level. Recommended Pitch and Roll "I" values of 0 to 15.

data.name: ProportionalAngle
data.value: When the using angle control mode the aircraft attitude should be proportional to the stick defelection. Pa (angle) by the outer control loop which now controls angle rather than rate. Ia reduces the final error from level flight. Pr (rate) is used by the inner rate control loop. The D term which attempts to remove wind and disturbances is shared with the rate control scheme. Always positive.

data.name: IntegralLimiter
data.value: Determines the maximum value the integral term in a control loop can have. Low value causes slow return to level. Too high a value can cause flips. Recommended values for pitch and roll of +4 to +15. Recommended values for yaw of +1 to +2. Upper value is automatically limitied by the your integral setting.

data.name: RollYawMix
data.value: FW aircraft it controls how much roll is coupled into the pitch command compensating for a tendency to pitch down in turns.

data.name: YawScale
data.value: Yaw stick sensitivity or multiplier. Two is twice as sensitive.

data.name: RollPitchScale
data.value: Roll/Pitch stick sensitivity or multiplier for RATE CONTROL when not in Bypass Mode. Two is twice as sensitive.

data.name: PPMDSM2
data.value: Currently the traditional PPM/PCM format is supported along with DSM2. DSM2 must use the ACTRO model with no mixing.

data.name: CameraGain
data.value: Affects how strong the pitch/rolling motions at the camera servos will be. Connect to K5=pitch servo. K6=roll servo. A setting of 0=no gyro control. Start with a setting of 1 and increase if necessary.

data.name: CameraRollTrim
data.value: Zero offset for camera roll servo.

data.name: AFType
data.value:
CAUTION CAUTION CAUTION CAUTION CAUTION CAUTION CAUTION CAUTION CAUTION CAUTION CAUTION CAUTION Sets Airframe type. When armed all servo channels are driven to 50%. If you select the incorrect airframe type and/or have a motor connected to a servo channel it will also go to 50% throttle.
Some configurations will also require setting the desired orientation. Does not work for UAVP PIC VERSION - uses specific hex file for the required airframe.

data.name: Balance
data.value: Only active for Tricopters and VTcopters. Allows compensation for steering motors which are of differing thrust to the left and right motors. The aircraft should not climb or descend when pitching. Experiment!

data.name: Compass
data.value: The compass is used to compensate for drift in the yaw gyro. More is not better as the compass can move quite a lot around the true heading. Normal range is 5-15.

data.name: AccGyroComp
data.value: If the aircraft does not come to level flight but continues to "lean" when the sticks are released after a change in direction or high angle banked turns then reduce this value. It is the amount by which the acceleration exceeds or falls below 1G when changing direction where we rapidly reduce our "confidence" in the accelerometer for compensating the gyro based attitude estimates (actually the S.Dev. from 1G). 0.2 seems OK.

data.name: BatteryCapacity
data.value: The capacity of your flight battery in units of 100mAH.

data.name: LowMotorRun
data.value: Allows motors to have a minimum throttle to prevent them from stopping in the air and also to have them all spinning for initial launch. Values of 5% to 20% recommended. Too high a value will cause fluttering in a fast descent.

data.name: Limiter
data.value: Scales altitude error to desired of climb or descent.

data.name: Neutral
data.value: Neutral values of the accelerometer are captured when the quad is initially powered on. It is important that the quad is not jiggled if neutral values are taken and input into the data windows. These values will vary by accelerometer and breakout board installation, but should remain fairly constant over time. They should be re-checked especially after a very "hard landing", or a board re-mount. You can also use the "Get values" button to automatically copy the data to the windows. As a suggestion to get better accelerometer values, load and use the testfirmware to check the values and get a good average. The testfirmware allows you to check the accelerometer values repeatedly by clicking on the Tools/Testsoftware/Liinear Sensor check line.

data.name: CrossTrack
data.value: Wind and other forces may push the aircraft off a direct line between waypoints or when returning home. This paramter determines how strongly the aircraft tries to reduce the distance from the direct path.

data.name: Proportional
data.value: Affects gyro control strength corresponding to stick input. The value is too low, when the quad reacts poorly or uncontrollably to stick inputs. The value is too high if the yaw is oscillating. The value will be positive for the yaw if the props on the front are CW rotatiing. Recommended values for pitch and roll 10 to 25. Recommended values for yaw 15 to 35.

data.name: Unterspannung
data.value: Alarm setting for the red LED and buzzer if installed for the LiPo voltage. Recommended values for 3s Lipos from 43 to 48.

data.name: Fence
data.value: Permitted radius of operation. Breach causes RTH when failsafes enabled.

data.name: AccTrim
data.value: It is VERY difficult to get the aircraft level for accelerometer calibration. These trims may be used to fine tune the accelerometer neutrals until the aircraft flies level with neutral (50% on the graphic) roll/pitch stick trims. The Adjust Acc Trim tool in UAVXSet may then be used after landing to transfer these trims to the main accelerometer neutral values.

data.name: NavIntLimit
data.value: Assists in achieving and maintaining the desired GPS position in wind. TBD experiment!

data.name: NavMaxGroundSpeed
data.value: Maximum transit GPS ground speed between waypoints and in RTH. If you increase this then you should also increase the Nav Slew otherwise the rate at which the aircraft can change pitch/roll angle will be too slow and you will get oscillations around the desired position. Experiment!.

data.name: NavAltProportional
data.value: Determines how much throttle to use to climb or descend to desired altitude. Experiment!

data.name: NavAltIntegral
data.value: Used to minimise the final error in desired altitude hold. Experiment!

data.name: NavRTHAltitude
data.value: The altitude desired when executing a return to home(RTH).

data.name: NavMagVar
data.value: The magnetic variation of True from Magnetic North in positive degrees East. Here is a site to find your Magnetic Variation: http://www.magnetic-declination.com/#

data.name: NavTurnLimit
data.value: The GPS positions are combined with the estimated position from the accelerometers. This trims how much of each is used. Experiment!

data.name: NavGPSSlew
data.value: Sets the the maximum pitch/roll angle when navigating or performing a RTH. Experiment!

data.name: NeutralRadius
data.value: Within this radius from the hold point the aircraft relies upon its neutral stability and the GPS is not used. Outside this radius the GPS signals are used. Values 0-5 Metres.

data.name: GyroType
data.value: The sensors used for the roll, pitch and yaw axes.

data.name: BaroScale
data.value: Used to cross calibrate the baro altimeter against GPS or other altitude reference.

data.name: ESCType
data.value: The type of ESCs used to control the motors.

data.name: TelemetryType
data.value: Controls the format of telemetry information: * None * UAVX - full flight control, nav and stats packets * UAVXMin - minimum attitude, location and battery information (Uses FrSky text transmission to UAVXGS) * FrSky - for Taranis and other FrSky telemetry compatible transmitters.

data.name: RxChannels
data.value: The TOTAL number of channels on your Rx, or if you are using a Parallel PPM connection between the RX and UAVX, the number of channels actually connected. UAVX currently uses and displays a maximum of 9 channels with a minimum of 7 channels being required for Navigation. UAVX can fy with Rx having four channels only but with no return to home capability or navigation.

data.name: NavNeutralRadius
data.value: The quadrocopter relies only on its gyroscopes and accelerometer if it is less than this radius from the desired GPS position. The radius corresponds to the likely error radius of the GPS position. While inside this radius no GPS based corrections are applied. Recommended value is 2.

data.name: RxLoopback
data.value: To test Spektrum and SBUS decoding connect RC3 to RC4 and observe Rx channel display - GKE Test function.

data.name: bit02
data.value: Rx Loopback

data.name: bit0
data.value: Mag Upright

data.name: bit01
data.value: Specifies that the magnetometer is inverted which can occur in external I2C combined GPS and magnetometer units.

data.name: bit6
data.value: Slow Descent

data.name: bit61
data.value: Rapid Descent

data.name: bit2
data.value: LEDs Disabled

data.name: bit21
data.value: LEDs Enabled

data.name: bit3
data.value: Flight Mode

data.name: bit31
data.value: Emulation Mode

data.name: bit4
data.value: Soaring Enabled

data.name: bit41
data.value: WP Nav Enabled

data.name: bit5
data.value: Failsafes Enabled

data.name: bit51
data.value: NO FAILSAFES

data.name: bit1
data.value: Autoland Disabled

data.name: bit11
data.value: Autoland Enabled

data.name: bit7
data.value: Disabled

data.name: bit71
data.value: Enabled

data.name: LegacyOk
data.value: Write sucessfull!

data.name: disconnected
data.value: Disconnected!
data.comment: Info wenn Verbindung bereits besteht und getrennt wird

data.name: flashInfo
data.value: Reboot PIC!
data.comment: Nach dem Brennen das Board neu starten

data.name: listviewConnected
data.value: Connected!

data.name: paraSet1
data.value: Parameter Set 1

data.name: paraSet2
data.value: Parameter Set 2

data.name: paraSetAktiv1
data.value: Parameter Set 1 (ACTIVE)

data.name: paraSetAktiv2
data.value: Parameter Set 2 (ACTIVE)

data.name: picConnected
data.value: Connected!

data.name: savePicBurn
data.value: Flash the PIC? *Note the PIC 16F876A is not supported! PIC 16F876 and 18F2620 are supported. Please select the correct firmware for the PIC when burning or updating. :)

data.name: writeLine
data.value: Write Line:

data.name: writeMax
data.value: from

data.name: writeOk
data.value: Successfull write!

data.name: writeParameter
data.value: Write Parameter:
